document_data.name: Labyrinth
document_data.mainbody: The '''Labyrinth''' was an ancient maze of tunnels in the [[Northdark]].
document_data.Geography:
The Labyrinth covered a large area of the [[Upperdark]] and [[Middledark]] beneath the [[Dessarin River]] and beyond. It connected the northern region of the [[Underdark]] to elsewhere in the south.

The Labyrinth was located some 100 miles south and west of the [[Darklake]] and [[Gracklstugh]].
document_data.Description:
The Labyrinth was a network of lava tubes tunnels made of cold black basalt. There were some paths and bridges. 
Depending on who was describing it, the tunnels either spanned 100 miles north to south and more than 50 miles east to west, There were a number of rifts that cut through the Labyrinth, so many tunnels emptied into massive chasms or dead-ended. Some staircases have been carved into stone to overcome these chasms.

Although there were a few well-documented paths used by merchants and travelers from [[Menzoberranzan]] and [[Gracklstugh]], travelers who wandered off the known paths were bound to get hopelessly lost and starve to death or be killed by the [[minotaur]]s that inhabited the tunnels. As well as minotaurs, a fallen angel, known as [[Baatral]], inhabited the labyrinth.

A number of portals were located in the Labyrinth. One led to the wilderness near [[Ched Nasad]], another to [[Oryndoll]].

Notable locations.[[Pit of Howling Grief]]: The Pit of Howling Grief was a rift in the ground filled with endless sounds of moaning and wailing. Next to the chasm was a slab of black rock that served as an altar to the demon lord [[Baphomet]].
Notable locations.[[House Jaelre]]: When House Jaelre dwelt here, they had a palace, which was abandoned by [[1372 DR]].
Notable locations.[[Gallery of Angels]]: A chamber housing seven fallen, petrified angels.<ref>
Notable locations.[[Adamantine Tower]]: An abandoned ''[[Daern's instant fortress]]'' haunted by [[demon]]s.
